prior_works.title: Group Equivariant Convolutional Networks
prior_works.role: Foundational theory of equivariant neural networks
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ISP leverages the core principle from G-CNNs that encoding symmetry groups in network architectures yields data-efficient learning; it extends this idea to SO(3) by operating on a spherical feature domain.

prior_works.title: Spherical CNNs
prior_works.authors: Carlos Esteves, Christine Allen-Blanchette, Ameesh Makadia, Kostas Daniilidis
prior_works.relationship_sentence: The paper’s image-to-sphere projection and subsequent SO(3) reasoning directly echo Spherical CNNs’ insight that mapping data to S2 enables rotation-equivariant processing without explicit 3D reconstruction.

prior_works.title: Gauge Equivariant Convolutional Networks on Riemannian Manifolds
prior_works.authors: Taco S. Cohen, Maurice Weiler, Berkay Kicanaoglu, Max Welling
prior_works.role: General framework for equivariant CNNs on manifolds (including the sphere)
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ISP’s choice to enforce rotational symmetries via spherical feature geometry is grounded in gauge-equivariant CNNs’ formalism for defining equivariant operations on curved domains like S2.

prior_works.title: Tensor Field Networks: Rotation- and Translation-Equivariant Neural Networks for 3D Point Clouds
prior_works.authors: Nathaniel Thomas, Tess Smidt, Steven Kearnes, Lusann Yang, Li Li, Kai Kohlhoff, Patrick Riley
prior_works.relationship_sentence: Prior 3D equivariant representations such as TFNs motivate ISP’s emphasis on strict SO(3) equivariance for visuomotor control, while ISP avoids point clouds by working in spherical image space.

prior_works.title: SE(3)-Transformers: 3D Roto-Translation Equivariant Attention Networks
prior_works.authors: Fabian B. Fuchs, Daniel E. Worrall, Volker Fischer, Max Welling
prior_works.relationship_sentence: SE(3)-Transformers established the efficacy of expressive equivariant models for 3D reasoning, a capability ISP adapts to image-derived spherical features to maintain SO(3) symmetry during policy learning.

prior_works.title: Equivariant Diffusion for Molecule Generation with Translation and Rotation
prior_works.authors: Emiel Hoogeboom, Victor Garcia Satorras, Clément Vignac, Max Welling
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ISP inherits the idea that enforcing group equivariance inside diffusion models improves sample efficiency and generalization, tailoring it to SO(3)-equivariant visuomotor diffusion policies.

prior_works.title: Diffusion Policy: Visuomotor Policy Learning via Action Diffusion
prior_works.role: Baseline framework for diffusion-based visuomotor control
prior_works.relationship_sentence: ISP builds on Diffusion Policy’s action-generation framework but augments it with an SO(3)-equivariant spherical feature space to gain substantial data efficiency and robustness over the original formulation.

synthesis_narrative:
Image-to-Sphere Policy (ISP) fuses two lines of prior work: diffusion-based visuomotor policies and group-equivariant neural representations. Diffusion Policy introduced action diffusion as a powerful generative framework for visuomotor control, but it lacked explicit handling of 3D rotational symmetries, limiting data efficiency. Concurrently, a rich literature on equivariant deep learning—beginning with Group Equivariant CNNs and extended by Spherical CNNs and Gauge Equivariant CNNs—showed that embedding symmetry constraints into model architectures can drastically reduce sample complexity. On the 3D side, Tensor Field Networks and SE(3)-Transformers demonstrated the effectiveness of strict SO(3)/SE(3) equivariance for geometric reasoning, while Equivariant Diffusion models proved that marrying diffusion with symmetry constraints yields practical gains in generative tasks.

ISP’s key insight is to project eye-in-hand RGB image features onto a spherical domain, enabling SO(3)-equivariant processing without reconstructing point clouds—a departure from earlier equivariant visuomotor approaches that relied on multi-camera point clouds fixed in the workspace. By enforcing rotational symmetry in the spherical feature space, ISP preserves the compelling benefits of equivariance (robustness, generalization, and sample efficiency) while aligning with modern single-camera, eye-in-hand setups. In doing so, it integrates diffusion policy training with principled SO(3) symmetry handling, operationalized through spherical representations and equivariant operators. This synthesis directly extends the successes of equivariant networks and equivariant diffusion to a practical, camera-first manipulation setting, delivering consistent improvements over strong baselines in both simulation and real-world experiments.
